text: 0 NBC has ordered a trio of additional episodes for the new drama series Manifest, but this is not a case of playing it safe. Traditionally when a network series debuts during the fall season, it does so with 13 episodes in the can. Then, depending on how the show does ratings - wise, a network might order nine additional episodes ( called a “ back nine ” ) to consist of a full season ’ s worth of episodes — 22 in total. With Manifest, however, NBC is taking a page out of cable ’ s book by allowing the drama series to conclude its first season with just 16 episodes, rather than have to draw the story out to 22.
